Dialogue.NPCText:
A solitary figure sits half-shrouded in shadows. A tribal mask hides his face, but pale eyes glint through the hollowed wood.

“...What brings you to the borderlands, wanderer? Few seek out an exile, unless in need of secrets or lost souls.”

Option.text: Who are you?
What do you watch for in these woods?
Why do you hide behind that mask?
I heard you seek redemption.
Tell me of your past, Keth. Who were you before the exile?
I'm just passing by.

Dialogue.NPCText: He hesitates. “Names lose meaning in exile. But once, I was Keth—scout, shadow-walker, voice for the council in darker places. Now... the tribe calls me traitor. Perhaps they are right.”

Option.text: Why were you exiled?
The past does not always define us.
You must have deserved it.
I must go.

Dialogue.NPCText: Keth traces the edge of his mask. “They say I aided Minax’s agents. The truth is knotted. I followed orders, shadowed invaders... but when the council fell, it was my mask they found at the fire. Someone framed me, but exiles have no voice. So I became a watcher—still loyal, though untrusted.”

Option.text: Who truly betrayed the tribe?
You wish to prove your loyalty?
This is not my concern.

Dialogue.NPCText: “That is why I linger. A shadow within shadows. My only hope is to unmask the true traitor. But for that, I need allies… and proof.”

Option.text: How can I help?
This sounds dangerous.
Your burden is your own.

Dialogue.NPCText: He turns, mask expressionless. “Without a name, a face is just another secret. I wear this not to hide, but to remember—who I was, and what I must become. When my name is cleared, perhaps I will take it off. Until then, let the mask bear my shame.”

Option.text: You seek redemption?
May the spirits grant you peace.

Dialogue.NPCText: His shoulders stiffen. “Redemption? If only it were so easy. The council demands proof of loyalty—something that cannot be faked. Will you aid me, stranger? Or will you, too, turn away?”

Option.text: I will help you prove your innocence.
What must I do?
The council is wise to doubt you.
I am no judge of your fate.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Perhaps you are right. The forest is full of old debts. If I am to return, it must be earned, not begged for. Leave me to my exile, if that is your wish.”

Option.text: On second thought, how could I help?

Dialogue.NPCText: “I watch for what others ignore: Minax’s cultists weaving in shadow, and Hinokami’s scouts straying too close to sacred groves. There is always something lurking at the edge of the firelight.”

Option.text: Seen anything unusual lately?
Does the tribe accept your warnings?
I’d like to help.
I must go.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Last night, the wind carried the scent of blood and foreign oil. Tracks of a three-toed beast—wrong for any native animal. Something is hunting us, or being hunted itself. I would investigate, but I cannot risk capture alone.”

Option.text: Let me track this beast with you.
You should warn the tribe.
Stay hidden, exile.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Few trust the words of an exile. Even fewer wish to hear them. But if you bring proof—be it fang, track, or talon—they might listen. Will you aid me in this hunt?”

Option.text: I will help hunt the beast.
The tribe can fend for itself.

Dialogue.NPCText: Keth leans forward, eyes intent. “There is a beast in these woods—warped by Minax’s corruption. If you can bring me its tainted fang as proof, the council may hear my plea again. But beware: others may offer you coin or favor to keep it for themselves. Choose carefully.”

Option.text: I will hunt this corrupted beast.
Who else might want the fang?
This task is not for me.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Take this: a hunter’s token. The beast lurks by the moonlit pool east of the sacred groves. Return with its fang, and you will have given me hope—perhaps a step toward home.”

Option.text: I will return with the fang.

Dialogue.NPCText: “The Hinokami want to study Minax’s corruption. Buccaneers seek trophies for dark rituals. Even Minax’s own would pay in secrets. But if you bring the fang to me, I swear by leaf and spirit, I will use it only to clear my name.”

Option.text: I trust you, Keth. The fang will be yours.
Perhaps others offer more...

Dialogue.NPCText: “Danger is all I know. But danger faced for truth is not the same as danger bought by lies. I will not blame you if you walk away.”

Option.text: No, I wish to help.
Farewell, exile.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Then keep to the safe paths, wanderer. These woods remember the names of those who trespass—and those who are forgotten.”

Option.text: On second thought, do you need help?
May the spirits guide you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
His hands tremble as he takes the fang.
“This… this is proof beyond doubt. You have done what none would. I am in your debt. Will you speak for me to the council, or do you wish a reward for yourself?”

Option.text: I will vouch for your loyalty.
A reward would be welcome.
I want nothing. Keep your peace.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Then I will carry your words to the council, with the proof in hand. May the spirits honor your aid, and may these woods welcome you always.”

He lowers his mask for just a moment, revealing grateful—if haunted—eyes.

Option.text: Farewell, Keth Hollowgaze.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Take this—gold hard-won, and freely given. Whatever my fate, you risked much for an exile. May fortune walk beside you.”

Option.text: Farewell, Keth.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Keth lowers his head. The carved mask creaks slightly as he exhales.

“Before the exile... I was Keth Hollowgaze. Shadow-Walker of the Verdant Tribes. I walked unseen through Minax’s camps. I whispered truths to the council. I carried messages across corrupted lands when no druid dared tread.”

He pauses, voice low. “But I also played the game of secrets too long. I began to enjoy it.”

Option.text: What do you mean 'enjoyed it'?
That must have been a lonely life.
You sound like a skilled scout. Why exile such a resource?
Do you still serve the tribe, even now?
This speaks to your strength. Carry it forward.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Secrets are power. And power, even for the quiet ones, is addictive. I could see the tremble in a war-chief's hands when I whispered a name. I began to bend truths, tweak orders... to see how far they would bend back.”

His voice turns bitter. “Eventually, they snapped. And I was caught in the whiplash.”

Option.text: You abused your station.
And yet you still care. That says something.
Such games always turn on the player.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Lonely? Yes. You learn to walk in silence so long, your own voice feels like a threat. I carved this mask not just to hide—but to remind me there are still faces behind faces. Even my own.”

“But in loneliness, I also listened. The trees speak. The wind shifts. Spirits remember.”

Option.text: You walk between worlds, then.
Perhaps you were meant to be something more than scout...

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Because when the pyres burned and the council lay slain, it was my mask they found at the scene. It mattered little that I’d warned them of a traitor in their midst.”

“They needed a scapegoat. And I had too many enemies who spoke just a little too softly in judgment.”

Option.text: And you still seek to return?
Could the real traitor still live?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“I watch. I warn. I stop what I can before it slithers to the groves. If that is not service, then what is?”

“Perhaps loyalty does not require approval—only choice.”

Option.text: You have my respect, Keth.
And what if the tribe never accepts you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Keth is silent for a long time. Then, with unexpected reverence, he touches your shoulder.

“You see more than most. Carry this moment like a flame. It may light your path when shadow closes in.”

Option.text: Thank you, Keth.
Let’s speak of other things.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Perhaps. Nura says I walk where spirits pass. She once offered me a shaman’s trial, but I refused. I was too proud then… too rooted in secrets.”

“Now, I wonder if I chose the wrong mask entirely.”

Option.text: You could still take the trial...
Perhaps pride was your real exile.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Keth’s voice steadies. “Would you walk it with me? The trial of spirit fire is not done alone. It begins with the Ashroot herb, found only near Verdant burial mounds.”

“Bring it to me… and we may walk between worlds.”

Option.text: I will seek the Ashroot herb.
Not now, perhaps later.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Yes. And when it does… you learn the rules were never yours to begin with. But still, I play. Even now.”

His voice drops. “Especially now.”

Option.text: I’ll watch your next move closely.
Option.action: SendMessage:You sense layers in this man...

Option.text: Enough talk for now.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Then perhaps… not all is lost. Even a single ember can spark the forest back to flame. I will remember this.”

Option.text: Let’s return to other matters.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Then I remain as I am. Masked. Exile. Guardian in the dark.”

“Sometimes the forest accepts trees that grow crooked—so long as they still reach for light.”

Option.text: Your roots still hold. Don’t forget that.
Farewell, for now.
